distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for .NET 5.0 is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
.NET Core is a managed-software framework. It implements a subset of the .NET
framework APIs and several new APIs, and it includes a CLR implementation.

New versions of .NET Core that address a security vulnerability are now available. The updated versions are .NET Core SDK 5.0.214 and .NET Core Runtime 5.0.17.

Security Fix(es):

* dotnet: excess memory allocation via HttpClient causes DoS (CVE-2022-23267)

* dotnet: malicious content causes high CPU and memory usage (CVE-2022-29117)

* dotnet: parsing HTML causes Denial of Service (CVE-2022-29145)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: .NET 5.0 security, bug fix, and enhancement update

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: A flaw was found in dotnet. The Microsoft Security Advisory describes the issue of the Apply MaxResponseHeadersLength limit for trailing headers to address a denial of service via excess memory allocations through the HttpClient.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2022-23267 dotnet: excess memory allocation via HttpClient causes DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2022-23267 dotnet: excess memory allocation via HttpClient causes DoS

cwe.name: Reliance on Cookies without Validation and Integrity Checking

notes.text: A flaw was found in dotnet. The Microsoft Security Advisory describes the issue of a malicious client that can send MyCookie=chunks-2147483647 without the actual cookie chunks, causing large allocations, exceptions, and excess CPU utilization on the server when it tries to read or delete that many chunks.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

cwe.name: Incorrect Behavior Order: Authorization Before Parsing and Canonicalization

notes.text: A flaw was found in dotnet. The Microsoft Security Advisory describes the issue of the ASP.NET FormFeature.cs causing a denial of service when HTML forms are parsed.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
